name: 劉傳銘
objective:
資料科學探索如何從大量、多元、非結構化的資料中發掘有價值的資訊，並有效提供相關的應用策略，探討的層面包括：資料處理及計算、資料儲存、數理統計及資料分析技術與應用等。本課程討論此一領域的進展，並使學生了解相關知識與技術工具，進而具備資料科學思維及應用能力。課程內容以廣度為主，主題包含資料管理、資料分析、資料視覺化、機器學習、深度學習，巨量資料等。
Data Science is an emerging multi-discipline field which is the intersection of computer science, statistics, and mathematics.  This course is designed to provide a hands-on introduction to Data Science by challenging students to build predictive models. In this course, we will discuss some fundamental components for efficiently and effectively handling the data.
schedule:
-An Overview
-Mathematical Preliminaries
-Data Munging
-Scores and Rankings
-Statistical Analysis
-Visualizing Data
-Mathematical Models
-Linear Algebra
-Linear and Logistic Regression
-Distance and Network Methods
-Machine Learning
-Case Study: Practical Applications
-Project Demo
scorePolicy:
Class Participation: 5%
Homework/Report: 25％
Project: 70% (Proposal 20% ; Final Demo 30%; Report 20%)
materials:
Steven S. Skiena, The Data Science Design Manual, Springer-Verlag, 2017, ISBN-13: 978-3319554433
References:

- Jure Leskovek, Anand Rajaraman and Jerey Ullman. Mining of Massive Datasets. v2.1, Cambridge University Press. 2014. (free online)
- Kevin P. Murphy. Machine Learning: A Probabilistic Perspective. ISBN 0262018020. 2013.
- Foster Provost and Tom Fawcett. Data Science for Business: What You Need to Know about Data Mining and Data-analytic Thinking. ISBN 1449361323. 2013.
- Avrim Blum, John Hopcroft and Ravindran Kannan. Foundations of Data Science.
(Note: this is a book currently being written by the three authors. The authors have made the first draft of their notes for the book available online. The material is intended for a modern theoretical course in computer science.)
